name: VWAT Family Services (Vietnamese Women's Association of Toronto)
mission: Non-profit helping refugee and immigrant families integrate into Canadian society since 1982; services for newcomers, youth, and seniors; preserving Vietnamese heritage via cultural festivals.
core_values: Helping refugees and immigrants integrate into Canadian society
Preserving Vietnamese heritage through annual cultural festivals
Improving the lives of people who have moved to Canada

values.description: Promoting healthy, balanced well-being for all community members
Striving for the highest quality in all our services and programs
Showing compassion and support to everyone we serve
Taking responsibility for our actions and commitments
Welcoming and respecting people from all backgrounds
Treating everyone with dignity and consideration
Ensuring fair access and opportunities for all

geo_hint: Along Garrison Creek south of Davenport Road; Treaty 13 territory (land acknowledgement).

directions.from_st_clair_west_station: #512 St. Clair streetcar W to Silverthorn Ave.
directions.from_jane_finch: #35 Jane bus S to Weston Rd → #89 Weston bus S to Avon Ave Loop → #168 Symington S to St. Clair Ave.
directions.from_keele_station: #41 Keele bus N to Old Weston Rd.

land_acknowledgement:
VWAT Family Services acknowledges we are on the land of many nations including the Mississaugas of the Credit,
the Anishnabeg, the Haudenosaunee, the Chippewa and Wendat peoples. This area is covered by Treaty 13.
Toronto derives from the Mohawk word “Tkaronto,” “the place in the water where the trees are standing.”
